title: Puerto Rico Debt-Adjustment Blueprint on Track for Judge’s Approval
sub_head: Final approval of the disclosures would clear the way for creditors to vote on the island’s financial restructuring
body:
The judge overseeing Puerto Rico’s bankruptcy case indicated she would approve detailed disclosures on a debt-adjustment plan for the territory, paving the way for creditors to vote on the sweeping financial restructuring.
Judge Laura Taylor Swain said at a virtual hearing Wednesday in the U.S. District Court in San Juan that she would approve the disclosure statement outlining a restructuring proposal for Puerto Rico’s bond and pension debts, subject to some changes expected in coming days.
